message.content:
We first compute the Quick Ratio. The quick assets exclude the inventory and are calculated as follows:

 • Cash on Hand: 2,339,224.10  
 • Bank Deposits: 4,292,000.00  
 • Interest Receivable: 14,796.43  
 • Accounts Receivable: 2,902,136.39  

Sum of quick assets = 2,339,224.10 + 4,292,000.00 + 14,796.43 + 2,902,136.39 = 9,548,156.92

The balance sheet tells us that Total Current Liabilities are 631,880.98. Therefore, the Quick Ratio is:

 Quick Ratio = Quick Assets / Current Liabilities  
        = 9,548,156.92 / 631,880.98  
        ≈ 15.12

Next, we calculate the Net Profit Margin using the income statement. The formula is:

 Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%

From the income statement:  
 • Net Profit = 1,167,783.63  
 • Total Revenue = 3,397,619.40

Thus,  
 Net Profit Margin = (1,167,783.63 / 3,397,619.40) × 100%  
           ≈ 34.37%

The final answer is provided below.

{
  "solution": {
    "Quick Ratio": "15.12",
    "Net Profit Margin": "34.37%"
  }
}
